t: Amazon is shipping expired food, from baby formula to old beef jerky, scaring consumers and putting big brands at risk
s: October 22, 2019 - Expired food is regularly sold to consumers via third-party vendors on Amazon. Amazon's marketplace has grown to millions of sellers, making it hard for the company to adequately police the platform. t: Amazon continues to incorrectly mark units as expired
s: The date was mismarked as expiring in 2023. This happens to us all the time. We sell mostly in Grocery. We keep track of our lots and expiration dates, so when Amazon claims it's expired we check against our records and if it's not expired we just create a case.

t: All About Selling Products with Expiration Dates on Amazon
s: December 19, 2024 - Usually, it is not Amazon but a third-party seller responsible for the sale of an expired product. But the news headlines do not distinguish between Amazon and third-party sellers. In October 2019 CNBC ran a news article with a sensational headline. And in March 2020, they did a follow-up that ...

It’s quite possible that there actually isn’t an expiration date for the product. Which would explain why there is no date on it. However, Amazon’s way of looking at expiration dates is just so that they remove the stock, when that date is reached. It does not rotate stock as you would expect.

If your order had already expired when you received it, contact Amazon and ask for either a replacement order or a refund. This is why I, myself, purchase only from Amazon itself and never a Third Party Seller (look to the right of the product page for the words "ships from Amazon, sold by Amazon").

t: Amazon Sellers Lawyer | Amazon Seller SUED over Allegation of Selling Expired Products
s: February 7, 2025 - We recently represented an Amazon seller who was sued under the allegation that the vitamins they were distributing were at or too near to the expiration date. t: Amazon marking products as expired when they are not ...
s: Automatic removal orders happen once products have been unfulfillable for 30 days. Yes, we’ve had a few items returned to us because Amazon wasn’t able to verify the expiration date before the 30 days, and we were unable to cancel the removal order.
